Sample from Cuadras-Auge distribution

Source: R/sample.R
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge.Rd

Draws n independent samples from a d variate Cuadras-Augé distribution with parameters alpha and beta.

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(n, d, alpha, beta)

Arguments

n

number of samples
d

dimension
alpha

rate of individual shocks
beta

rate of global shock

Value

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge implements an optimized version of the exogenous shock model representation for the Cuadras-Augé family and returns an \(n \times d\) array matrix with rows corresponding to the independent samples of size \(d\).

Details

  • alpha is the shock intensity of shocks that affect only single components.

  • beta is the shock intensity of the global shock that affects all components.

See also

rmo_esm

Other samplers: rmo_esm(), rmo_ex_arnold(), rmo_lfm_cpp()

Examples

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 0.5, 0.2)
#>            [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] 1.4757833 1.6936306
#>  [2,] 1.0040554 0.8760558
#>  [3,] 0.1535530 0.1535530
#>  [4,] 1.3012315 0.2417508
#>  [5,] 1.0375040 1.0375040
#>  [6,] 2.3291067 0.7442524
#>  [7,] 1.4194126 1.4194126
#>  [8,] 0.7906217 0.6363337
#>  [9,] 0.2676391 0.8241136
#> [10,] 0.9340837 0.9340837
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 0, 1)      ## comonotone
#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 0.22027539 0.22027539
#>  [2,] 2.14951551 2.14951551
#>  [3,] 1.21293415 1.21293415
#>  [4,] 3.45901982 3.45901982
#>  [5,] 0.10312832 0.10312832
#>  [6,] 1.39260818 1.39260818
#>  [7,] 0.03253287 0.03253287
#>  [8,] 0.49232446 0.49232446
#>  [9,] 0.02419059 0.02419059
#> [10,] 1.13985958 1.13985958
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 1, 0)      ## independence
#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 0.95179766 0.37453354
#>  [2,] 0.03117124 0.23960932
#>  [3,] 9.15313311 0.81848123
#>  [4,] 0.00278538 0.10580041
#>  [5,] 1.83457146 0.26476943
#>  [6,] 0.68774057 0.45952242
#>  [7,] 3.00186797 1.02844045
#>  [8,] 0.49854530 0.14163011
#>  [9,] 1.23387958 1.26415490
#> [10,] 1.39129122 0.05221346
